subject: Re: and----nothin"!!
author: Fiona Broome
full_text:
Well, here are my thoughts...

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "purplespacefriend" <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>  If the box and EVP was the only source of information for 2012, I wouldn't give it another thought--but being that every culture in the world has "foreseen" that date, I doubt if it was nothing they would mention it. 

--- Gee, thanks, Frank! *LOL* I didn't know about all that supporting evidence. Here I was blissfully thinking it was just that the Mayans ran out of space on their calendar.

> 
>  Fortunately, I remain intrigued with EVP just because something talks that shouldn't be there, I don't really care what they say. 
> 

--- I'm interested in this for both reasons: I want to understand why they talk to us, and I'm also interested in what they're saying, whether it's true or false in our world, and whether they're talking directly to us, or sometimes we're eavesdropping on their conversations, elsewhere.

I'm leaving open the possibility that, in their world/universe, something did happen on June 17th, and this was one of those eavesdropping moments... or two or three.


>  Then there's the problem that nothing is written in stone, it is often changable, or maybe just a probability/possiblity.
> 

--- Exactly! The influence of the observer can be significant.  But, that's what I keep reminding people who take their horoscopes far too seriously:  Sometimes, logical consequences (good and bad) seem to be unavoidable.  Everything _else_ seems to open doors, but what actually happens may be heavily influenced by the person's outlook (attitude or "observer" factor)... or perhaps that proverbial butterfly in China changed everything and nobody expected it.

Cheerfully,
Fiona
